segments.en: “A fool is known by three things.

segments.pli: Ayoniso pañhaṃ kattā hoti, ayoniso pañhaṃ vissajjetā hoti, parassa kho pana yoniso pañhaṃ vissajjitaṃ parimaṇḍalehi padabyañjanehi siliṭṭhehi upagatehi nābbhanumoditā hoti.
segments.en: They ask a question improperly. They answer a question improperly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they disagree with it.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo.
segments.en: These are the three things by which a fool is known.

segments.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
segments.en: An astute person is known by three things.

segments.pli: Yoniso pañhaṃ kattā hoti, yoniso pañhaṃ vissajjetā hoti, parassa kho pana yoniso pañhaṃ vissajjitaṃ parimaṇḍalehi padabyañjanehi siliṭṭhehi upagatehi abbhanumoditā hoti.
segments.en: They ask a question properly. They answer a question properly. And when someone else answers a question properly—with well-rounded, coherent, and relevant words and phrases—they agree with it.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
segments.en: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
